intro: Adnaria rigida, commonly known as the rigid sea holly, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Goodeniaceae. It is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves, which are adapted to withstand the harsh conditions of coastal environments. The plant produces small, blue or violet flowers that bloom during the summer months. It is typically found in rocky intertidal zones and shallow marine habitats. Adnaria rigida plays a role in coastal ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various marine organisms.
